parameters.name: BOffset
parameters.description: True to offset the gusset section plane from the selected reference point in ArrayRefPoints, false to not

parameters.name: DOffset
parameters.description: Value by which to offset the gusset section plane from the selected reference point in ArrayRefPoints; valid only if BOffset is true

parameters.name: BFlipOffsetSide
parameters.description: True to specify the gusset section plane offset on the opposite side of the selected reference point, false to not; valid only if BOffset is true

parameters.name: ProfDimType
parameters.description: Type of gusset profile dimensioning scheme as defined in swSheetMetalGussetProfileDimType_e (see Remarks )

parameters.name: DIndentDepth
parameters.description: Gusset indent depth; valid only if ProfDimType = 0

parameters.name: DLength
parameters.description: d1 gusset leg length; length of sheet metal from bend to intersection with first end of gusset; valid only if ProfDimType = 1 (see Remarks )

parameters.name: BUseAngle
parameters.description: True to dimension the angle that is formed by the intersection of the gusset with either face adjacent to the bend; valid only if ProfDimType = 1 (see Remarks )

parameters.name: DHeight
parameters.description: d2 gusset leg length; length of sheet metal from bend to intersection with second end of gusset; valid only if ProfDimType = 1 (see Remarks )

parameters.name: DAngle
parameters.description: Angle formed by intersection of gusset with one face adjacent to the bend; valid only if ProfDimType = 1 and BUseAngle is true (see Remarks )

parameters.name: BFlipSides
parameters.description: True to swap d1 and d2 legs in the dimensioning scheme, false to not; valid only if ProfDimType = 1 (see Remarks )

parameters.name: DWidth
parameters.description: Gusset width

parameters.name: DThickness
parameters.description: Gusset thickness

parameters.name: BDraft
parameters.description: True to draft gusset side faces, false to not

parameters.name: DDraftAngle
parameters.description: Angle by which to draft the gusset side faces; valid only if BDraft is true

parameters.name: BInnerCornerFillet
parameters.description: True to fillet the gusset inner corners, false to not

parameters.name: DInnerCornerFilletRadius
parameters.description: Inner corner fillet radius; valid only if BInnerCornerFillet is true

parameters.name: BOuterCornerFillet
parameters.description: True to fillet the gusset outer corners, false to not

parameters.name: DOuterCornerFilletRadius
parameters.description: Outer corner fillet radius; valid only if BOuterCornerFilletRadius is true

parameters.name: GussetType
parameters.description: Type of gusset as defined in swSheetMetalRibGussetType_e

parameters.name: BEdgeFillet
parameters.description: True to fillet the edges of a flat back gusset, false to not; valid only if GussetType is flat

parameters.name: DEdgeFilletRadius
parameters.description: Edge fillet radius for the flat back gusset; valid only if BEdgeFillet is true and GussetType is flat

parameters.name: ArrayOfFaces
parameters.description: Array containing one or two IFace2 s that are the legs of the gusset feature: Two flat faces adjacent to a bend Two flat faces adjacent to a circular bend One cylindrical bend face One flat face and one non-planar face adjacent to a toroidal bend One toroidal bend face (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ArrayRefLines
parameters.description: Array containing one of the following entities that is perpendicular to the gusset section plane: Linear IEdge ISketchSegment (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ArrayRefPoints
parameters.description: Array containing one of the following to position the gusset section plane: IVertex ISketchPoint IRefPoint (see Remarks )

parameters.name: BFlipOffsetSide
parameters.description: True to specify the gusset section plane offset on the opposite side of the selected reference point, false to not; valid only if BOffset is true

parameters.name: ProfDimType
parameters.description: Type of gusset profile dimensioning scheme as defined in swSheetMetalGussetProfileDimType_e (see Remarks )

parameters.name: DIndentDepth
parameters.description: Gusset indent depth; valid only if ProfDimType = 0

parameters.name: DLength
parameters.description: d1 gusset leg length; length of sheet metal from bend to intersection with first end of gusset; valid only if ProfDimType = 1 (see Remarks )

parameters.name: BUseAngle
parameters.description: True to dimension the angle that is formed by the intersection of the gusset with either face adjacent to the bend; valid only if ProfDimType = 1 (see Remarks )

parameters.name: DHeight

parameters.name: BFlipSides

parameters.name: DWidth
parameters.description: Gusset width

parameters.name: DThickness
parameters.description: Gusset thickness

parameters.name: BDraft

parameters.name: BInnerCornerFillet

parameters.name: BOuterCornerFillet

parameters.description: Outer corner fillet radius; valid only if BOuterCornerFilletRadius is true

parameters.name: ArrayOfFaces
parameters.description: Array containing one or two IFace2 s that are the legs of the gusset feature: Two flat faces adjacent to a bend Two flat faces adjacent to a circular bend One cylindrical bend face One flat face and one non-planar face adjacent to a toroidal bend One toroidal bend face (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ArrayRefLines
parameters.description: Array containing one of the following entities that is perpendicular to the gusset section plane: Linear IEdge ISketchSegment (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ArrayRefPoints
parameters.description: Array containing one of the following to position the gusset section plane: IVertex ISketchPoint IRefPoint (see Remarks )

remarks:
If you pass an empty array to...
Then...
ArrayRefLines
This method assumes the reference line is the bend line adjacent to the entities in ArrayOfFaces.
ArrayRefPoints
You must set BOffset to true and specify DOffset for an assumed reference point.
For insertion of the first gusset, the assumed reference point is on the end of the sheet metal bend. For second and subsequent gusset insertions, the assumed reference point is on the edge of the gusset last inserted.
Instead of calling this method, you can call
IModelDocExtension::SelectByID2
to pre-select the references before calling
IFeatureManager::InsertSheetMetalGussetFeature
.
If ProfDimType = 1, to dimension the gusset profile using...
Specify...
Both faces of the bend
DLength of d1 leg
DHeight of d2 leg
BUseAngle = false
BFlipSides = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning
One bend face and the angle it forms with the gusset
DLength of d1 leg
DAngle of angle formed by gusset intersecting d1 leg
BUseAngle = true
BFlipSides = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning
Opposite bend face and the angle it forms with the gusset
DHeight of d2 leg
DAngle of angle formed by gusset intersecting d2 leg
BUseAngle = true
BFlipSides = true to swap d1 and d2 legs during dimensioning
See the SOLIDWORKS Help for more information about sheet metal gusset features.
